metadata.title: CVE-2022-44267 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ImageMagick 7.1.0-49 is vulnerable to Denial of Service. When it parses aPNG image (e.g., for resize), the convert process could be left waiting forstdin input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-44267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm5').
